This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://open.spotify.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fopen.spotify.com%2F) ### Comment > Spotify player gets stuck on ads sometimes on web player with AdGuard enabled - no songs, nothing, not even ad plays. Only solution is to refresh the browser and replay the playlist. Trying to change playlist doesn't work either, completely stuck playerand now playing view. While with AdGuard disabled, ads load normally and player works as intended. One important thing: It happens after 2-3 times ads are skipped. e.g I open player, play a playlist, ads come normally due course, gets skipped twice or even thrice, songs playing uninterrupted, after that it gets stuck on ad and nothing plays. Like spotify detects adblocker is on after 2-3 skips and blocks plays (guess). ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/83mi74u948w0g4kgws88k0sg8g8k4sg9pssix2rkdg.png?nc=1)

issue.title: www.chumplady.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.chumplady.com/other-woman-asks-chump-lady-to-inform-the-wife-about-an-affair/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.chumplady.com%2Fother-woman-asks-chump-lady-to-inform-the-wife-about-an-affair%2F) ### Comment > The chumplady.com website loads noticeably slower than other websites and ads have been “leaking” through. At first it was just ads on a pop up lower banner, but then ads started appearing in the body of the post as well. There are also blank spaces and large light grey boxes in between the text, which I presume are the spots where ads would go. Other websites I frequent don’t have that and the look is much more seamless. ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
[NSFW] [https://transadvice.org](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftransadvice.org)
### Comment
> I am one of the Community Stewards at https://transadvice.org - Your DNS server is reporting to our users that our peers support network serving the transgender community is a "phishing or malicious website"
> 
> Please properly classify our website. Thank you.

### [NSFW] Screenshots
  [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/pv5phl17f6ogo8ckkgc0ccwccsc04wo67skt0dqqns.png?nc=1)

Information | Value
--- | ---

comment.body:
TransAdvice.org has been a peer support site since 2010, serving the community providing a safe and non-judgmental space online.

It is unclear how we are classified as "phishing or malicious" - Our community is worried that this could happen to other LGBTQIA+ websites as well.

Please let us know if you have any questions at all!

Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://open.spotify.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fopen.spotify.com%2F) ### Comment > Spotify player gets stuck on ads sometimes on web player with AdGuard enabled - no songs, nothing, not even ad plays. Only solution is to refresh the browser and replay the playlist. Trying to change playlist doesn't work either, completely stuck playerand now playing view. While with AdGuard disabled, ads load normally and player works as intended. One important thing: It happens after 2-3 times ads are skipped. e.g I open player, play a playlist, ads come normally due course, gets skipped twice or even thrice, songs playing uninterrupted, after that it gets stuck on ad and nothing plays. Like spotify detects adblocker is on after 2-3 skips and blocks plays (guess). ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/83mi74u948w0g4kgws88k0sg8g8k4sg9pssix2rkdg.png?nc=1)

The same on my end (I don't see that ad), but I see a different ads only when app is not filtered.

By the way, in the case of Spotify app installed directly from Spotify website, it might be necessary to add it to filtered apps in AdGuard settings.
AdGuard -> Settings -> Network ->List of filtered applications -> Add Spotify

### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.2.700.1 System version: | `android 16` Browser: | Edge Tracking protection: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base Browsing Security: | enabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=ext&product_version=5.2.700.1&system_version=android+16&browser=edge&filters=2&browsing_security.enabled=true&browsing_security.statistics_enabled=false&stealth.enabled=false)

This section is part of `chp_ads_blocker`, please move it to `Regular rules` section.
By the way, this rule causes that ad leftovers are not hidden with apps.

Maybe it could be more specific?
For example:
```adblock
goonchan.org#@#ins.adsbygoogle[data-ad-slot]
goonchan.org#@#ins.adsbygoogle[data-ad-client]
```
And scriptlet:
```adblock
goonchan.org#%#//scriptlet('prevent-setTimeout', 'adsbygoogle')
```

<hr>

Additionally, for apps to hide another ad leftover this rule is required:
```adblock
goonchan.org##iframe[src^="https://creative.mavrtracktor.com/"]
```

<hr>

There is also a `popunder` (on the main page when link to video is clicked, and it looks like that it occurs only sometimes because it's triggered only when `.6 > Math.random()`) which can be fixed by:
```adblock
goonchan.org#%#//scriptlet('abort-on-stack-trace', 'open', 'onClick')
```

comment.body:
Looking into it, apparently AdGuard SafeBrowsing uses some random group called SOCRadar as one of the several (secretive) upstream sources for it, with SOCRadar being the sole closed-source group to claim it's phishing according to https://www.virustotal.com/gui/url/a398cd77599a286fd3c78c2c5b79ecd4d45bb191b12d50d3fb380d5a2d529540

Whatever kind of obtuse scanning system SOCRadar uses seem to have gone off-the-rails based on https://socradar.io/labs/app/ioc-radar/transadvice.org, and they (SOCRadar) seem to be actively trying to avoid receiving reports on false positives; `vt@socradar.io` is the only publicly known way to report such.

I take a qualified guess that Team AdGuard proper (of which I am not a part) will whitelist `transadvice.org` as well, though I'd most certainly also recommend them to remove SOCRadar from the list of sources.

issue.body:

[NSFW] [https://transadvice.org](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftransadvice.org)
### Comment
> I am one of the Community Stewards at https://transadvice.org - Your DNS server is reporting to our users that our peers support network serving the transgender community is a "phishing or malicious website"

issue.title: soundcloud.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://soundcloud.com/you/likes](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsoundcloud.com%2Fyou%2Flikes) ### Comment > 2 placeholders on the bottom of the list of liked songs when logged in. After I spent several months trying to figure out what the placeholders were supposed to be, it seems to me that Soundcloud intended them to be ads for Amazon Audible. > > I propose `soundcloud.com##li.badgeList__item:not(:has(a)):has(>.audibleTilePlaceholder)` ``` Username: @DandelionSprout ``` ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [NSFW] [https://aagmaal.cx/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Faagmaal.cx%2F) ### Comment > When I click on a video on this website https://aagmaal.cx/ , it automatically opens another website in the background (pop-under / redirect). > The redirect happens on user interaction (click/tap) even though AdGuard is enabled. ``` Username: @ShuvrojyotiRoy ``` ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/4nufl1yhhm688g8g0s44gwk8w0cs0ko6h302efkvf8.jpg?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Android v4.12.2 System version: | `Android 16` Browser: | Chrome License type: | paid AdGuard mode: | VPN HTTPS filtering: | enabled Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
Block trackers,
Send Do-Not-Track header

**Miscellaneous**:
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests DNS filtering: | server: `Automatic DNS`
